results.headline: A Sexploitation Filmmaker’s Work and Relationship
results.summary_short: “A Life in Dirty Movies” explores the work of Joe Sarno, known for his 1960s soft-core films, and his long relationship with his wife and collaborator, Peggy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Life in Dirty Movies

results.headline: A Dangerous Visitor Makes Himself at Home
results.summary_short: In “The Guest,” a man with suspect intentions ingratiates himself with a dead soldier’s family.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Guest

results.headline: A Rocker Covers a Lot of Ground in One Day
results.summary_short: The documentary/drama “20,000 Days on Earth” follows Nick Cave from psychoanalysis in England to stage in Australia.

results.headline: A Violent Tale Induces a Familiar Flinch
results.summary_short: “No Good Deed” stars Idris Elba as an escaped convict with a violent history against women, invading the house of a stay-at-home mother.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of No Good Deed

results.headline: Now 11 Is the New 14, and the New 8
results.summary_short: In Genevieve Bailey’s documentary “I Am Eleven,” 11-year-olds in 15 countries talk about home, school, war, love, marriage and visions of the future.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I Am Eleven

results.headline: Like Tweedledum and Tweedledee, Only They’re Angsty
results.summary_short: In “The Skeleton Twins,” Bill Hader and Kristen Wiig play twins who reconnect after a long impasse and jointly struggle with their present and past.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Skeleton Twins

results.headline: The Void Beckons: It’s Time to Leap
results.summary_short: In “Bird People,” a businessman and a maid at an airport hotel abruptly seek escapes from unhappy lives.

results.headline: Losing Is the Real Victory for One Family
results.summary_short: “The Quitter,” directed by and starring Matthew Bonifacio, focuses on a washed-up baseball star.

results.headline: Follow That Whale
results.summary_short: “The Pirates,” directed by Lee Seok-hoon, is an action comedy that takes place on the high seas at the start of the Joseon dynasty.

results.headline: Love and Neuroses in Mamaroneck
results.summary_short: “The Man on Her Mind,” based on a play by Alan Hruska, deals with objects of desire, real and imaginary.

results.headline: A Spy Shaped by Manipulation and Shame
results.summary_short: Nadav Schirman’s documentary thriller “The Green Prince” tells the story of a Palestinian recruited as a spy by the Shin Bet, Israel’s internal security agency, and his Israeli handler.

results.headline: A Son Comes Home: Cue the Father Clash
results.summary_short: Max Gail stars as a retired college professor in “The Frontier,” a family drama.

results.headline: Quiet Bartender’s Secret
results.summary_short: In “The Drop,” based on a short story by Dennis Lehane, a decade-old unsolved murder casts a shadow on a Brooklyn bar.

results.display_title: The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby: Her/Him
results.headline: When Sorrow Is Deeper Than Love
results.summary_short: In chronicling the end of a marriage, “The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby” crosses a landscape mined with loss, secrets and questions of identity.

results.headline: Mississippi Sounds Live on in New Musicians
results.summary_short: “Take Me to the River” looks to the past and the future of a vanishing musical legacy.

results.headline: Curses! Over and Over Again
results.summary_short: The Trailer Park Boys, the Canadian mockumentary franchise, creates a film outlet for its vaunted limited vocabulary.

results.headline: Mired in an Abyss of Despair in Taipei
results.summary_short: Few words are spoken in “Stray Dogs,” Tsai Ming-liang’s exercise in Asian miserablism, with the modern industrial cityscape of Taipei seen as a chilly wasteland.

results.summary_short: “Smiling Through the Apocalypse: Esquire in the 60s” is Tom Hayes’s film about his father’s time as editor of the magazine.

results.headline: And They Had Such Chemistry
results.summary_short: In “Honeymoon,” wedded bliss in a rural cabin gives way to terror when a wife starts acting strange.

results.headline: Searching for the Object of a Mailman’s Longing
results.summary_short: In “Finding Fanny,” the actress Dimple Kapadia plays a busybody in a backwater town who joins others in doing a good deed.
